original: mu tsa sogs kyi dbyangs la aan bi ka ra na la na yig a'a ga ma'o //🔽mu tsli grol ba la'o zhes pa 'di nas brtsams nas pi sha cha shas la'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pa mu tsa sogs so //
analyzed: mu tsa sogs kyi dbyangs la aan bi ka ra na la na yig a'a ga ma'o // mu tsli grol ba la'o zhes pa 'di nas brtsams nas pi sha cha shas la'o zhes pa'i mthar thug pa mu tsa sogs so //
translated: The svarita is the anubandha of the na of the anusvāra in the case of the mucc syllables, etc.🔽The mucc syllables, etc., begin with mucc and end with piś.

original: mu tsa sogs kyi dbyangs gang yin pa de las pha rol tu aan bi ka ra na pha rol la na yig a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu tsa sogs kyi dbyangs gang yin pa de las pha rol tu aan bi ka ra na pha rol la na yig a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
translated: The svarita is the anubandha of the na of the anusvāra after the mucc syllables, etc.

original: aa yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: aa yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
translated: The letter a is the object of expression.🔽muñcati

original: munytsa ti / munytsa te /🔽lumba te / lumba te /
analyzed: munytsa ti / munytsa te / lumba te / lumba te /
translated: lumvate

original: binda ti / binda te /🔽mutsli grol ba la'o //
analyzed: binda ti / binda te / mutsli grol ba la'o //
translated: vindati🔽mucc liberare

original: mu sli gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: mu sli gcod pa la'o //
translated: mucc secare

original: bi dlam thob pa la'o //
analyzed: bi dlam thob pa la'o //
translated: vidh labdhum

original: ya dza sogs nyid las gnyis ga ste ti dang te'o //
analyzed: ya dza sogs nyid las gnyis ga ste ti dang te'o //

original: aan bi / 'dis na yig a'a ga ma'o //🔽aanbi ka ra na la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aan bi / 'dis na yig a'a ga ma'o // aanbi ka ra na la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: anubandha🔽mokṣa

original: mokt'a / aan smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: mokt'a / aan smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of an is for the sake of clarifying the form.

original: 'dir gzhan mu tsa sogs kyi bi ka ra na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan mu tsa sogs kyi bi ka ra na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the other anubandhas of the mucc syllables, etc., do not exist.

original: mardzin sha dag gi dhu ta la'o //
analyzed: mardzin sha dag gi dhu ta la'o //
translated: In the dhātu of the pure many.

original: du ma sdzo dag pa la'o //
analyzed: du ma sdzo dag pa la'o //
translated: In the purity of the many.

original: na sha mi mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: na sha mi mthong ba la'o //
translated: In the non-vision of the na.

original: 'di dag gi dhut pha rol la dbyangs las pha rol du na yig a'a gam 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi dhut pha rol la dbyangs las pha rol du na yig a'a gam 'gyur ro //
translated: In the dhātu of these, the na syllable becomes ā after a vowel.

original: madk'a mam kshyanti /
analyzed: madk'a mam kshyanti /
translated: The m of mad is not seen.

original: aa mam kshyat /
analyzed: aa mam kshyat /
translated: The a of ama is not seen.

original: du masdzo dag pa la'o //
analyzed: du masdzo dag pa la'o //
translated: In the purity of the many.

original: t'a dang syanti dang syata'o //
analyzed: t'a dang syanti dang syata'o //
translated: The ta and syati and syāt.

original: yu dzi tu dzi zhes sogs kyis ait med do //
analyzed: yu dzi tu dzi zhes sogs kyis ait med do //
translated: The yu and jitu and jita and so on do not have ita.

original: 'dis na @220a * //
analyzed: 'dis na @220a * //
translated: By this,

original: yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: the na syllable becomes ā.

original: dhut rnams kyi gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dhut rnams kyi gsum pa'o //
translated: The third of the dhātus.

original: zhes pas sa'i da'o //
analyzed: zhes pas sa'i da'o //
translated: By this, the sa.

original: ta sde'i tsa ta'i sde pa zhes pas da'i dza'o //
analyzed: ta sde'i tsa ta'i sde pa zhes pas da'i dza'o //
translated: The ca class is the ta class. By this, the da.

original: brashtsi masdzo dag gi dhut la zhes pas mtha'i dza yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: brashtsi masdzo dag gi dhut la zhes pas mtha'i dza yig dbyi'o //

original: tsa sde'i ki'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ki'o //
translated: The ca class is the ki.

original: sde pa la sde pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sde pa la sde pa'i mtha'o //

original: sha nyid do //
analyzed: sha nyid do //

original: na sha'i nges par yang /🔽nasht'a tam / nam kshyati /
analyzed: na sha'i nges par yang / nasht'a tam / nam kshyati /
translated: The na is also definite.

original: aa nam kshyata /
analyzed: aa nam kshyata /
translated: The na of naṣṭātmā, the na of na kṣyati,🔽the a of ana kṣyat.

original: na sha mi mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: na sha mi mthong ba la'o //
translated: In the non-vision of the na.

original: na'i na'o // t'a dang sya ti dang syata'o //
analyzed: na'i na'o // t'a dang sya ti dang syata'o //

analyzed: ra dha sogs nyid kyi phyir ait rnam par brtag pa'o //
translated: The it is for the sake of the ra and so on.

analyzed: na yig a'a ga ma'o // tsha sha dag gi'ang zhes pas sha'o //

original: nadzdzye / nashyate /

original: dzambha ya ti /

analyzed: 'tshe ru 'jug go //

analyzed: pi ba ti'i dbyi ste / aa bhy'a sa'i 'ang a'ita'o //

original: ain dang tsan pha rol la zhes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ain dang tsan pha rol la zhes pa kho na'o //

original: au pa dh'i zhes pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: au pa dh'i zhes pa'ang ngo //

original: pa 'thung ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a ain dang tsan pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa 'thung ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a ain dang tsan pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: pā iti pānam, asyopadhā itinaśca parataḥ.

original: aa bhy'a sa'i 'ang aa'i nyid do //🔽@223a * // aa p'i pyat /🔽aa p'i pyat'am /
analyzed: aa bhy'a sa'i 'ang aa'i nyid do // @223a * // aa p'i pyat / aa p'i pyat'am /
translated: abhyāsasyāpi ai.🔽apapyata,🔽apapyatam,

original: aa p'i pyan /🔽p'a 'thung ba la'o //
analyzed: aa p'i pyan / p'a 'thung ba la'o //
translated: apapyan,🔽pā iti pānam.

original: 'thung du 'jug go la aina'o //
analyzed: 'thung du 'jug go la aina'o //
translated: pāyayati,🔽śāśāsa, sahavyavayorinaḥ.

original: sh'a tsh'a s'a hva by'a be pa rnams kyi ain la zhes pa a'a yig gi aa yi ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'a tsh'a s'a hva by'a be pa rnams kyi ain la zhes pa a'a yig gi aa yi ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a iti ādeḥ.🔽di,

original: di'o // t'ama'o //
analyzed: di'o // t'ama'o //
translated: tam,🔽ana,

original: aan no // tsana'o //
analyzed: aan no // tsana'o //
translated: can.

original: 'dis au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis au pa dh'a dbyi'o //
translated: anena upadhā it.

original: ain la byas pa ni gnas can dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las pa lan gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: ain la byas pa ni gnas can dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las pa lan gnyis brjod do //

original: thung ngu'o // aa bhyasa'i a'i nyid do //
analyzed: thung ngu'o // aa bhyasa'i a'i nyid do //
translated: hrasvaḥ, abhyāsasyāi.

original: tishtha ti'i aita'o //
analyzed: tishtha ti'i aita'o //
translated: tiṣṭhatīti it.

original: shth'a gnas pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a'i ain pha rol la dang tsan pha rol las ai nyid du 'gyur ro //🔽aa tishthi pat /
analyzed: shth'a gnas pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a'i ain pha rol la dang tsan pha rol las ai nyid du 'gyur ro // aa tishthi pat /
translated: ṣṭhā, to stand. In this [word] the upapada i becomes i after a and c.🔽a-tiṣṭhati.

original: shth'a gnas / gnas su 'jug go la aina'o //
analyzed: shth'a gnas / gnas su 'jug go la aina'o //
translated: ṣṭhā, to stand. [The root] enters the [verbal] base. iṇ.

original: aartti hr'i tsl'i r'i ksha yi dang aat mtha' rnams kyi zhes pas pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aartti hr'i tsl'i r'i ksha yi dang aat mtha' rnams kyi zhes pas pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: ar-tti, to delight; hri, to take; cāli, to scratch; kṣa, to cut; a, end. The letter pa becomes ā after these.

original: di'o // tsana'o //
analyzed: di'o // tsana'o //
translated: di, that; ca, and.

original: 'dis au pa dh'a'i ai nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis au pa dh'a'i ai nyid do //
translated: By this [rule] the upapada i becomes i.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: [The letter] is pronounced twice.

original: ait pas las pha rol gyi sgra med pa'o //
analyzed: ait pas las pha rol gyi sgra med pa'o //
translated: it, from the root after a. The sound of the [preceding] a is elided.

original: dzi ghra ti'i yang na'o //
analyzed: dzi ghra ti'i yang na'o //
translated: jighrati.

original: ghra dri nye bar len pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a'i ain dang tsa na pha rol la ai nyid du yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ghra dri nye bar len pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i au pa dh'a'i ain dang tsa na pha rol la ai nyid du yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: ghra, to smell. In this [word] the upapada i becomes i after a and c.

original: aa dzighri pat /
analyzed: aa dzighri pat /
translated: a-jighrati.

original: dri 'dzin du 'jug go la aina'o //
analyzed: dri 'dzin du 'jug go la aina'o //
translated: ghra, to smell. [The root] enters the [verbal] base. iṇ.

original: aartti hr'i tsl'i zhes sogs kyis pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aartti hr'i tsl'i zhes sogs kyis pa yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: ar-tti, to delight; hri, to take; cāli, to scratch; kṣa, to cut; a, end. The letter pa becomes ā after these.

original: di'ang ngo // tsa na'o //
analyzed: di'ang ngo // tsa na'o //
translated: di, that; ca, and.

original: 'dis au pa dh'a'i ai nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis au pa dh'a'i ai nyid do //
translated: By this [rule] the upapada i becomes i.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: [The letter] is pronounced twice.

original: aa bhya'i sa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: aa bhya'i sa'i bya ba'o //
translated: abhyāsa, action.

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /
translated: In one direction,

original: aa dzi ghra pat /
analyzed: aa dzi ghra pat /
translated: a-jighrapat

original: mtshungs pa ma phyis pa'i zhes pas ai nyid do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma phyis pa'i zhes pas ai nyid do //
translated: with the equivalent of “not subtracted” is i itself.

original: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par kun bshad pa'i rkang pa lnga pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: jo bo drag 'byor gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa slob ma la phan par kun bshad pa'i rkang pa lnga pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary composed by the venerable Dravyasvāmin, which is called “The Explanation for the Benefit of Students,” is complete in the section on the fifth line.

original: // / ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yon tan med pa la aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: // / ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yon tan med pa la aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: Now, for those that are not connected, the quality of anushanga is not.

original: gang rnams kyi ait rjes su yod pa de rnams ni ait rjes su 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi ait rjes su yod pa de rnams ni ait rjes su 'brel pa'o //
translated: Those that have i after them are connected with i.

original: de nas dgag pa'i tshig sdud do //
analyzed: de nas dgag pa'i tshig sdud do //
translated: Then the negative particles are collected.

original: byings gang rnams kyi ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin te ai yig rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa de rnams kyi aa nu sham ga yon tan med pa'i rkyen pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //🔽shra sya te /
analyzed: byings gang rnams kyi ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin te ai yig rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa de rnams kyi aa nu sham ga yon tan med pa'i rkyen pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro // shra sya te /
translated: For those roots that are not connected with i, that is, not connected with the vowel i, the condition of anushanga, the quality, is not, and the i is elided in the following.🔽shrasya te

original: dhva sya te /
analyzed: dhva sya te /
translated: dhvasya te

original: bhra sya te /
analyzed: bhra sya te /
translated: bhrasya te

original: shransu dang dhvansu dang bhransu 'og tu ltung ba la'o //
analyzed: shransu dang dhvansu dang bhransu 'og tu ltung ba la'o //
translated: shran su, dhvan su, and bhransu mean “falling down.”

original: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
analyzed: byings thams cad pa la yana'o //
translated: yan is for all roots.

original: 'dis aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'dis aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: This is anusamgati.

original: sa n'i pra sya te /
analyzed: sa n'i pra sya te /
translated: Saniprasyate.

original: da n'i dhva sya te /
analyzed: da n'i dhva sya te /
translated: Danidhvasyate.

original: shin tu ltung ngo la ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu ltung ngo la ya sgra'o //
translated: Very much falls, the sound laya.

original: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: Anusamgati.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: It is said twice.

original: bam tsi / shransi /
analyzed: bam tsi / shransi /
translated: Vamci, shransi,

original: dhvansa / bhransa /
analyzed: dhvansa / bhransa /
translated: dhvani, bhranshi.

original: mtha' ni'o zhes pas n'i a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni'o zhes pas n'i a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The end is ni. Thus, ni-agama.

original: thams cad la na rjes su 'brel pa dang zhes pas yon tan med do //
analyzed: thams cad la na rjes su 'brel pa dang zhes pas yon tan med do //
translated: In all, na is connected. Thus, there is no quality.

original: shrasta:/ dhvasta:/ bhrashta:/ nishtha'o zhes pas kta'o //
analyzed: shrasta:/ dhvasta:/ bhrashta:/ nishtha'o zhes pas kta'o //
translated: Shrasht, dhvashta, bhrashta, nishthe. Thus, kta.

original: yan dang 'dra ba'i dngos po las yon tan med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan dang 'dra ba'i dngos po las yon tan med pa nyid do //
translated: From a thing similar to a case, there is no quality.

original: tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo @223b zhes pas sha nyid do //
analyzed: tsha sha dag gi 'ang ngo @223b zhes pas sha nyid do //
translated: Also from sha and sha, it is sha itself.

original: ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is it that is not connected with iti?

original: bantya te / bid mngon par /
analyzed: bantya te / bid mngon par /
translated: Bantyate, vidam.

original: ai yig ni na yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni na yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
translated: The letter i is for the meaning of the letter na-agama.

original: aita rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa rnams kyi zhes dgag pa byas pa'i shugs las na yig a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: aita rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa rnams kyi zhes dgag pa byas pa'i shugs las na yig a'a ga ma'o //
translated: By the negation of those not connected with iti, by implication, the letter na is agama.

original: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by no quality?

original: shransi t'a / shvasta ni'i t'a'o //
analyzed: shransi t'a / shvasta ni'i t'a'o //
translated: śraṃsitaḥ, śvastanītaḥ.

original: 'o na 'di yang yon tan med pa ste kut sogs rnams kyi 'di pha rol la yon tan dkag pa mthong ba'i phyir yan sogs rnams kyang 'ga' zhig tu gang yon tan med par rab tu grags pa rnams kyis grub pa de rnams kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'o na 'di yang yon tan med pa ste kut sogs rnams kyi 'di pha rol la yon tan dkag pa mthong ba'i phyir yan sogs rnams kyang 'ga' zhig tu gang yon tan med par rab tu grags pa rnams kyis grub pa de rnams kyang mthong ngo //
translated: But this is also not a good quality, because we see that kuta and so on negate a quality in the other. And we also see that yena and so on are sometimes well known to be without a quality.

original: yon tan can dper na /
analyzed: yon tan can dper na /
translated: Those that have a quality are, for example,

original: dz'a ga tya te zhes pa sogs yon tan dang yon tan med pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de la rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dz'a ga tya te zhes pa sogs yon tan dang yon tan med pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de la rnam par gzhag pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: jāgatyate and so on. What is the rule for the presentation of those that have a quality and those that do not have a quality?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dkyus ma dang khyad par gyi tshig sogs nye ba med pa rkyen gang la dgag pa bya ba ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma dang khyad par gyi tshig sogs nye ba med pa rkyen gang la dgag pa bya ba ste /
translated: The rule is that a negation is made in regard to a condition where there is no proximity of words such as ordinary and special.

original: yon tan mtshungs pas yon tan dang bcas pa ci lta ba bzhin du yan sogs ni nye ba'i tshig sogs dkyus ma'i yon tan bkag pa gang la yon tan med pa ma yin pa de dper na kut sogs mtshan gzhi'i ngor yang /
analyzed: yon tan mtshungs pas yon tan dang bcas pa ci lta ba bzhin du yan sogs ni nye ba'i tshig sogs dkyus ma'i yon tan bkag pa gang la yon tan med pa ma yin pa de dper na kut sogs mtshan gzhi'i ngor yang /
translated: That which is not without a quality is, for example, kuṭa, etc.

original: khyad par las brtan pa gang las 'di ni bag med pa las yon tan dang yon tan med pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par las brtan pa gang las 'di ni bag med pa las yon tan dang yon tan med pa ste /
translated: From the perspective of the example, stability is from a particular. From this, there is a quality and a lack of quality.

original: yon tan dang bcas pa'am yon tan med pa bag med pa can kho na las so //
analyzed: yon tan dang bcas pa'am yon tan med pa bag med pa can kho na las so //
translated: From one who is careless, there is only a quality or a lack of quality.

original: 'dir yon tan dang bcas pa nyid dam yon tan med pa nyid rab tu grags pas grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yon tan dang bcas pa nyid dam yon tan med pa nyid rab tu grags pas grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, being endowed with a quality or being without a quality is not established by what is well known.

original: rkyen tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different conditions.

original: dambhi'i ait med par gyur pa las aa nu sham ga dbyi bar 'dod de /
analyzed: dambhi'i ait med par gyur pa las aa nu sham ga dbyi bar 'dod de /
translated: The i of dambhi is elided, and anuśaṃga is desired to be elided.

original: dhispati / danbhu tshul 'chos pa la'o //
analyzed: dhispati / danbhu tshul 'chos pa la'o //
translated: Dhibh is for hypocrisy.

original: sana'o // san la 'di'i aita yang na'o //
analyzed: sana'o // san la 'di'i aita yang na'o //
translated: San is for san. The i of this is also na.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: The two are expressed.

original: byings kyi gsum pa dang po'i zhes pas da'i dha'o //
analyzed: byings kyi gsum pa dang po'i zhes pas da'i dha'o //
translated: The third of the roots is the first, which is dhi.

original: danbhi'i aita'ang ngo zhes pas dbyangs kyi ai nyid do //
analyzed: danbhi'i aita'ang ngo zhes pas dbyangs kyi ai nyid do //
translated: The vowel i is the same as the i of danbhî.

original: sgra med pa rnams la shit ma yin pa rnams kyi dang po'o zhes pas bha'i ba'o //
analyzed: sgra med pa rnams la shit ma yin pa rnams kyi dang po'o zhes pas bha'i ba'o //
translated: The b of bhavati is the first of the sibilants, because of the absence of the sibilants.

original: 'di nas aa bhy'a sa'i dbyi'o zhes pas aa bhya sa dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'di nas aa bhy'a sa'i dbyi'o zhes pas aa bhya sa dbyi'o //
translated: The avagraha is from this point on, because of the avagraha of avyasî.

original: ait med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ait med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of i?

original: di dambhi sha ti /
analyzed: di dambhi sha ti /
translated: The d of dambhisatî.

original: na sgra las kyang bi ka ra na las so //
analyzed: na sgra las kyang bi ka ra na las so //
translated: The v is from the word na, because of the vikarana.

original: ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa yon tan med pa zhes pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: ait rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa yon tan med pa zhes pa mi 'jug go //
translated: The absence of i is not connected with the absence of guna.

original: na sgra las bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: na sgra las bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: The avagraha of the other is from the word na, because of the vikarana.

original: him sti / him sta:/
analyzed: him sti / him sta:/
translated: Himstî, himstah, himsanti.

original: him santi / hri ha dang hi si 'tshe ba la'o //🔽ai yig ni na yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
analyzed: him santi / hri ha dang hi si 'tshe ba la'o // ai yig ni na yig a'a ga ma'i don to //
translated: Hriha and hisi are for injury.🔽The vowel i is the meaning of the following na.

original: ait rjes su 'brel pa min pa zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las na a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: ait rjes su 'brel pa min pa zhes pa'i shes par byed pa las na a'a ga ma'o //
translated: The na is from the word na, because of the avagraha of the following.

original: ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes na sgra'o //
analyzed: ru dha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes na sgra'o //
translated: The na is from the word ru, because of the svarita.

original: ru dha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: ru dha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: The avagraha is the end of the vikarana of ru, etc.
This

original: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //🔽rjes su nga ro'o //🔽bham kti / bhamkta:/
analyzed: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o // rjes su nga ro'o // bham kti / bhamkta:/
translated: anuśabda, after-sound.🔽bhakti, devotion.

original: bhanydzanti / bhanydzo nye ba la'o //
analyzed: bhanydzanti / bhanydzo nye ba la'o //
translated: bhakṣaṇa, eating.

original: snga na bzhin du na sgra dang mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: snga na bzhin du na sgra dang mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: As before, the na is a sound and the i is a suffix.

original: tsa sde'i ke'o //
analyzed: tsa sde'i ke'o //
translated: The ca class has ke.

original: aa nu lam ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa nu lam ga dbyi'o //
translated: anusamdhāna, connection.

original: na sgra las zhes pa'i nus pas bye pa po la'o //
analyzed: na sgra las zhes pa'i nus pas bye pa po la'o //
translated: The na is a sound and the i has the power of “from.”

original: gzhan pas ni bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aa nu sham ga dbyi ba med do ;
analyzed: gzhan pas ni bi ka ra na las pha rol gyi aa nu sham ga dbyi ba med do ;
translated: The other, from vikaraṇa, does not have the anusamdhāna elided.

original: / bi ka ra na las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: / bi ka ra na las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is from vikaraṇa?

original: nanda ti / ainda /
analyzed: nanda ti / ainda /
translated: nandati, to shine.🔽granthi, knot.

original: branthi / granthi /
analyzed: branthi / granthi /
translated: danbhī, deceit.

original: danbhi rnams kyi pa ro& ksha la sogs yon tan med pa la'o //
analyzed: danbhi rnams kyi pa ro& ksha la sogs yon tan med pa la'o //
translated: These have parā, and kṣa and so on are for the absence of qualities.

original: nyi aindhi 'bar ba /
analyzed: nyi aindhi 'bar ba /
translated: The sun is indha, burning.

original: shrantha dang gran tha gzhung bsgrig pa la'o //
analyzed: shrantha dang gran tha gzhung bsgrig pa la'o //
translated: Śraṃthā and granthā are for arranging the text.

original: danbha tshul 'chos pa la'o zhes pa 'di rnams kyi pa ronyaksh'a yon tan med pa pha rol la aa nu sham ga dbyi bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: danbha tshul 'chos pa la'o zhes pa 'di rnams kyi pa ronyaksh'a yon tan med pa pha rol la aa nu sham ga dbyi bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Danbhī is deceit. These have parā, and kṣa and so on are for the absence of qualities. The anusamdhāna is elided.

original: / sa m'idhe /
analyzed: / sa m'idhe /
translated: samīḍha,

original: nyi aindhi 'bar ba la'o //
analyzed: nyi aindhi 'bar ba la'o //
translated: The sun is indha, burning.

original: nyi'i sgra ni nyi rjes su 'brel pa dang 'dod pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyi'i sgra ni nyi rjes su 'brel pa dang 'dod pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word nyā means “after” and “desire.”

original: sam sngon du'o //
analyzed: sam sngon du'o //
translated: Sam is before.🔽Pa is ro.

original: pa ro& ksha'i ae'o //
analyzed: pa ro& ksha'i ae'o //
translated: Aṃ is kṣa.

original: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa nu sham ga dbyi'o //
translated: Aṃ is anuśaṃsa.🔽Dvi is samāna.

original: gnyis brjod / mtshungs pa'i ring po'o //🔽n'a mi dang po lji ba ldan pa zhes pas aam gyi rkyen mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis brjod / mtshungs pa'i ring po'o // n'a mi dang po lji ba ldan pa zhes pas aam gyi rkyen mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Dīrgha is nāma.

original: sam'a dhi zhes pa 'di'i sdeb sbyor yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sam'a dhi zhes pa 'di'i sdeb sbyor yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Samādhi is because of its existence in this meter.

original: shre tha tu:/ shrethu:/
analyzed: shre tha tu:/ shrethu:/
translated: Śreṣṭha is śreṣṭha.

original: gretha tu:/ de bha tu:/
analyzed: gretha tu:/ de bha tu:/
translated: Gretha is gretha.🔽Deva is devah.

original: de bhu:/ aa tus ausa'o //
analyzed: de bhu:/ aa tus ausa'o //
translated: Deva is aṭuṣa.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //

translated: The roots of these, and likewise the roots that end in ra and la, become long before the word para of the asya upaghāta, sicyate, and parasmāt.🔽Avādāti.

analyzed: aa kho r'i ta /

analyzed: aa shva la l'i ta /

analyzed: aa bhra / ma bhra ;

analyzed: babhra / tser 'gro ba'i don to //

analyzed: dz'e gri sad pa la'o //

analyzed: 'di dag gi sitsa dang pa rasmee'i tshig pha rol la yon tan du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dbyangs mtha' rnams kyi sitsa la pa rasmee'i la'o zhes pas 'phel ba thob pa la'o //

original: aa shva y'i ta /🔽aa dz'a ga r'i ta /
analyzed: aa shva y'i ta / aa dz'a ga r'i ta /

original: aarnu ti'i yang na'o //
analyzed: aarnu ti'i yang na'o //

analyzed: a'urnunya sgrib pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i sitsa la dang pa rasmee tshig pha rol la yon tan du yang na 'gyur ro //

original: proorna b'it / proonn'a b'i ta /
analyzed: proorna b'it / proonn'a b'i ta /

original: pronu b'id ta /
analyzed: pronu b'id ta /

original: 'dis yon tan yang na'o //
analyzed: 'dis yon tan yang na'o //

analyzed: phyogs gcig la sitsa la pa rasmee la zhes pas 'phel ba'o //

analyzed: dbyangs dang po rnams kyi dang po'i 'phel ba'o //

analyzed: aartti sartti dag gi aan la'o //

analyzed: na ni na rjes su zhes pa'i dgag pa 'gegs pa'o // a'a ra ta /

original: aa sa ra ta /
analyzed: aa sa ra ta /

analyzed: pusha sogs kyi mdos aana'o //

original: 'dis yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dis yon tan no //

analyzed: zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: snga ma bzhin aana'o // dz'agarta'i k'a ri ta'o la'o //

analyzed: dz'a ga ra ya ti /

analyzed: sad du 'jug la aina'o //

analyzed: k'a ri ta la zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: dza dz'a g'a ra /

analyzed: aata'o // yan a'a sh'isha dgal ya la'o //

analyzed: dz'a gri'i yan pha rol dang a'a sh'i sh'i ya yig pha rol la yon tan du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dza gri'i pa ro& ksha yon tan med pa pha rol la yon tan du 'gyur ro // dza dz'a ga ra du:/

analyzed: dz'a grit / aanti'o //

analyzed: dza dz'a g'a ra /

analyzed: 'phel ba'i cho ga nyid la yon tan du mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: brtsegs pa dang po'i ri ta'i yang ngo //

analyzed: brtsegs pa dang po'i tita ti ri yig pa ronyaksha yon tan med pa la yon tan du 'gyur ro //

original: sa sva ra tu:/
analyzed: sa sva ra tu:/

analyzed: sa sva tu:/ da dhva ra tu:/

analyzed: da dhva tu:/ spri sgra la'o //

analyzed: dhvi gnod pa la'o //

original: rit ces pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rit ces pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: tsikshi ya tu:/ tsikshi yu:/

original: kshi zad pa la'o //
analyzed: kshi zad pa la'o //

analyzed: byings kyi ai'i yi ge dang au'i yi ge dag mtha'i dbyangs dang po la ai ya au ba dag ces pas ai ya'o //

analyzed: brtsegs pa dang po zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: tsa kra tu:/ yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: tsa kra tu:/ yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by 'without a good quality'?

original: pa smra ra /
analyzed: pa smra ra /
translated: Pasmṛta.

original: smri sems pa la'o //
analyzed: smri sems pa la'o //
translated: Smṛ is for thought.

original: aata'o // rita mtha' rnams kyi 'ang ngo //
analyzed: aata'o // rita mtha' rnams kyi 'ang ngo //

analyzed: byings r'it kyi mtha' can rnams kyi'ang pa ro& ksh'a yon tan med pa la yon tan du 'gyur ro // bi tsa ka ra tu:/
translated: The aṃ and ākṣa suffixes are also added to the roots ending in ṛta, and the aṃ and ākṣa are added to the roots that do not have the qualities.🔽vicakartavīti,

analyzed: ba tsi ka tu:/ ni dza gar tu:/ ni dzag tu:/ kri g-yang ba /

original: gri gsal bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: gri gsal bar byed pa la'o //
translated: kṛ- is for “to clarify.”

original: bi dang ni sngon du'o ;
analyzed: bi dang ni sngon du'o ;
translated: vi- is for “before.”

original: / yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: / yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: bi tsa k'a ra /🔽ritstsha'i ri ta'i'o //
analyzed: bi tsa k'a ra / ritstsha'i ri ta'i'o //

analyzed: ritstsha dbang po nyams pa dang rmongs pa dag la'o zhes pa 'di'i ri yig gang yin pa de'i pa ro& ksha la yon tan du 'gyur ro //
translated: riccha- is for “deprived of faculties” and “confused.” The ṛ of this [root] is for aṃ and ākṣa.

original: yon tan med pa la zhes pa 'dir mi 'jug go //
analyzed: yon tan med pa la zhes pa 'dir mi 'jug go //
translated: “Without qualities” does not apply here.🔽ānarca,🔽ānarcatu,

original: a'a nartstsha / a'a nartstsha tu /🔽a'a nartstshu / gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: a'a nartstsha / a'a nartstsha tu / a'a nartstshu / gnyis brjod do //
translated: ānarcantu,

original: ri'i yi ge aa yig go //
analyzed: ri'i yi ge aa yig go //
translated: The ṛ of this [root] is a.

original: dang po'i aa'i thams cad du'o zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: dang po'i aa'i thams cad du'o zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: Since it is said that “the first a is lengthened everywhere,” it is long.

original: ri yig la 'ang ngo zhes pas na a'a ga ma'o //
analyzed: ri yig la 'ang ngo zhes pas na a'a ga ma'o //
translated: Since it is said that “the ṛ is also,” it is āga.

original: 'dis yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dis yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality.

original: pa ro& ksha la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: pa ro& ksha la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of parakṣa?

original: ritstshat'a / sh'inga'i byings thams cad pa la'o //
analyzed: ritstshat'a / sh'inga'i byings thams cad pa la'o //
translated: Ritsatā. It is in the sense of all roots.

original: shing nyal ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i byings thams cad pa pha rol la yon tan du 'gyur @226b ro ;
analyzed: shing nyal ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i byings thams cad pa pha rol la yon tan du 'gyur @226b ro ;
translated: It is in the sense of a lying tree. This is a root in the sense of all. It becomes a quality in the other.🔽It is in the sense of all roots. It is in the sense of the five.

analyzed: / thams cad kyi byings thams cad pa a'atma ne la panytsa m'i'o zhes pas dgag pa thob pa la'o // she te / sha y'ita /
translated: It is in the sense of having obtained a prohibition.🔽Śeta.

original: she t'am / aa sha te /
analyzed: she t'am / aa sha te /
translated: Śetām. Aśata.

original: sh'ing nyal ba /
analyzed: sh'ing nyal ba /
translated: Śaṅ lying.

original: batta m'a ni'i te dang sa sapta m'i'i a'it dang / banytsa mi'i t'am dang hya sta n'i'i ta'o //
analyzed: batta m'a ni'i te dang sa sapta m'i'i a'it dang / banytsa mi'i t'am dang hya sta n'i'i ta'o //
translated: It is in the sense of the seven. It is in the sense of the five. It is in the sense of the three. It is in the sense of the two. It is in the sense of the one.

original: 'dis yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dis yon tan no //
translated: It is in the sense of a quality.

original: sh'ing zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sh'ing zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of śaṅ?

original: stu ste byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: stu ste byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: shishye / pa ro& ksh'a'i ae'o //
analyzed: shishye / pa ro& ksh'a'i ae'o //
translated: Śiṣye. Parakṣā. Ai.

original: snga ma brtsegs pa min pa'i ai'i zhes pas ya'o //
analyzed: snga ma brtsegs pa min pa'i ai'i zhes pas ya'o //
translated: The previous one is not a stack. It is ya.

original: ya la a'i ni aa yi'o //
analyzed: ya la a'i ni aa yi'o //

original: yon tan med pa smos pa 'dir sbrel te /
analyzed: yon tan med pa smos pa 'dir sbrel te /

original: sh'inga'i ya yig yon tan med pa pha rol la aa yi ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sh'inga'i ya yig yon tan med pa pha rol la aa yi ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //

original: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
translated: The syllable i is the meaning of the expression.

original: shya te / sh'a shayya te /
analyzed: shya te / sh'a shayya te /

original: ya sgra'o // 'dis aa ya'o //
analyzed: ya sgra'o // 'dis aa ya'o //

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //

original: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: she yam / dbyangs las ya'o zhes pas ya'o //

analyzed: a'ata mtha' rnams kyi ai tsa la a'a yi'o //

analyzed: byings a'a yig gi mtha' can rnams kyi ai tsa pha rol la a'a yi ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //

original: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni brjod pa'i don to //

analyzed: des na a'a ga ma 'di 'jigs pa'i rgyu'i don la 'gyur te /

analyzed: ru tsa sogs nyid las a'adma ne'i tshig go //

original: phyogs gcig la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig la /

original: mundo bh'a sa ya te /

analyzed: bshad pa las yang na a'a nyid do //

analyzed: de'i tshig la byed pa po la aa yi zhes pas a'a yi'o //

analyzed: noo 'oo sgra'o //

analyzed: aa ti sngon du'o //

analyzed: ma ning la dbyangs thung ngu'o zhes pas thung ngu'o //

analyzed: aa las a'a t'a ma aa tha ma'i dang po'i ai'o //

analyzed: a'a t'a ma dang a'a th'a ma zhes pas dbye'o //

original: pa tse th'am ;
analyzed: pa tse th'am ;

analyzed: panytsa m'i'i a'a t'am dang a'a th'ama'o //

analyzed: aan bi / 'dis a'a yig gi ai nyid do //

analyzed: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: kurb'a t'ama / kurb'a th'a ma /
analyzed: kurb'a t'ama / kurb'a th'a ma /

analyzed: kriny byed pa la'o //

analyzed: tan sogs las au'o //

original: ka ro ti'o zhes pas yon tan no //
analyzed: ka ro ti'o zhes pas yon tan no //

analyzed: aa'i au yig go // a'a te a'a the zhes pa'i 'ang ngo //

analyzed: a'a te dang a'a the zhes zlas dbye'o //

analyzed: aos snga ma bzhin du 'jig go //

analyzed: aa yig las pha rol gyi a'a te dang aa the zhes pa 'di dag gi dang po'i ai nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The i of the first of these āte and āthe from the a vowel becomes i.

original: pa tse te /
analyzed: pa tse te /
translated: Pacetāṃ,

original: pa tse the //
analyzed: pa tse the //
translated: pacetathāṃ.

original: aa dze te /
analyzed: aa dze te /
translated: Ajetāṃ,

original: rnam par 'gyur ba nges par bstan pa'i phyir dbyangs pha rol la aa te dang aa the zhes pa 'di dag rang bzhin du dngos po'i don la'o //🔽des na / pa tse ti ai te /

original: pa tse the ai ti ;
analyzed: pa tse the ai ti ;
translated: pacetathete.

original: ai ti'i sgra las gzhan gyi aa yig gi mtha'i gnyis brjod pa rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ai ti'i sgra las gzhan gyi aa yig gi mtha'i gnyis brjod pa rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the other a-kāra at the end of i-ti is expressed by the two,

original: pa ts'as ba he ai ti /
analyzed: pa ts'as ba he ai ti /
translated: pa-ca and ba-he i-ti.

original: aa'i ba ma dag la ring po'o //
analyzed: aa'i ba ma dag la ring po'o //

original: y'a sgra'i nga sapta m'i'i'o //
analyzed: y'a sgra'i nga sapta m'i'i'o //
translated: The sound ya is the seventh ma-i.

original: aa yig las pha rol gyi sapta m'i'i sgra y'a'i sgra'ang ai nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa yig las pha rol gyi sapta m'i'i sgra y'a'i sgra'ang ai nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound ya is the sound ma of the other a-kāra, and it becomes i itself.

original: pa tseta / pa tse t'ama /
analyzed: pa tseta / pa tse t'ama /
translated: pa-ce-ta, pa-ce-taṃ,

original: ba tse:/ y'a ta dang ya t'am dang y'asa'o //
analyzed: ba tse:/ y'a ta dang ya t'am dang y'asa'o //

original: aana'o // 'dis p'a ya ai'o //
analyzed: aana'o // 'dis p'a ya ai'o //
translated: a-na. By this, pa-ya i.

original: ya zhes brjod par bya ba la sgra smos pa ni y'a sgra'i dbyangs dang bcas pa ai nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: ya zhes brjod par bya ba la sgra smos pa ni y'a sgra'i dbyangs dang bcas pa ai nyid kyi don to //
translated: The mention of the sound ya is for the purpose of the sound ya with the svarita, which is i itself.

original: pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las ya yig tsam gyis ai nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi bya ba la dang po rnam par 'gyur ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las ya yig tsam gyis ai nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the statement, “The first changes in the action of the other,” the ya-kāra alone becomes i.

original: 'o na de'i ai nyid byas pa na slar yang ya nyid la y'a sgra nyid du gnas pa zhes mdos byas par 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i ai nyid byas pa na slar yang ya nyid la y'a sgra nyid du gnas pa zhes mdos byas par 'gyur ba ci zhe na /
translated: Well, when its i is made, then again the ya itself remains as the sound ya. What is the point of the statement?

original: bden te mdo brtsams pa'i shugs ai yig gi ya nyid du ma byas par thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden te mdo brtsams pa'i shugs ai yig gi ya nyid du ma byas par thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: True, but the force of the composition of the sutra is that the ya of the ai is not made into a ya of the i.

original: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽aa dy'ata / sapta m'i'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na / aa dy'ata / sapta m'i'i zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “from a”?🔽It means “from a da.”🔽What is meant by “seven mi”?

original: tsi k'itshhy'a ta /
analyzed: tsi k'itshhy'a ta /
translated: It means “from ci ki.”

original: a'a shisha'i y'ata'o //
analyzed: a'a shisha'i y'ata'o //
translated: It means “from a shi shi.”🔽The vowel a is the inner branch. Since there is no attainment from the elimination of the a, it does not become i.

original: a'a'ing dbyi'o // nang gi yan lag nyid las aa yig dbyi ba la thob pa med pa'i phyir ai nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sapta mi smos @234b pas dbyangs bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir de'i snga ma'i mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'a'ing dbyi'o // nang gi yan lag nyid las aa yig dbyi ba la thob pa med pa'i phyir ai nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sapta mi smos @234b pas dbyangs bsgyur ba nyid kyi phyir de'i snga ma'i mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not mentioned in the seven mi, the vowel is not changed.

original: y'am yus dag gi ai ya ma ai yus dag go //
analyzed: y'am yus dag gi ai ya ma ai yus dag go //
translated: The ya and yu become i ya and i yu.

original: aa yig las pha rol gyi y'a ma dang yus zhes pa 'di dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ai yam dang ai yus zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽pa tse y'am /
analyzed: aa yig las pha rol gyi y'a ma dang yus zhes pa 'di dag grangs ji lta ba bzhin du ai yam dang ai yus zhes pa 'di dag tu bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // pa tse y'am /
translated: From the a, the ya and yu become i ya and i yu, respectively.

original: pa tse yu:/ ya dze yam /
analyzed: pa tse yu:/ ya dze yam /
translated: What is meant by “pa tse ya”?🔽It means “pa tse yu.”🔽What is meant by “ya dze ya”?🔽It means “ya dze yu.”

original: ya dze yu:/ sapta mi'i y'am dang yusa'o //
analyzed: ya dze yu:/ sapta mi'i y'am dang yusa'o //
translated: The seven mi are ya and yu.🔽It means “an.”

original: aana'o // 'dis ai yam dang ai yus dag go //
analyzed: aana'o // 'dis ai yam dang ai yus dag go //
translated: This is i ya and i yu.

original: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: aa las zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the syllable a?

original: kur++y'am / kur++yu:/ sapta m'i'i 'ang ya la'o zhes pas au yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: kur++y'am / kur++yu:/ sapta m'i'i 'ang ya la'o zhes pas au yig dbyi'o //
translated: The letter u is the ending of kuryāṃ, kuryuḥ, sapta, and mi.

original: sham sogs rnams kyi yan la ring po'o //
analyzed: sham sogs rnams kyi yan la ring po'o //
translated: The long vowel is for the ending of śa and so on.

original: mtshon par bya ba'i ched du ba nyid kyi phyir brda sprod pa'i sham sogs brgyad gzung ngo //
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba'i ched du ba nyid kyi phyir brda sprod pa'i sham sogs brgyad gzung ngo //

analyzed: gam ai shu yam rnams kyi tsha'o //

analyzed: pa rasmee zhes pa mi 'jug go //

analyzed: gamli 'gro ba la'o //

original: aishu 'dod pa la'o //
analyzed: aishu 'dod pa la'o //

original: ya mu nye bar 'jig pa la'o //
analyzed: ya mu nye bar 'jig pa la'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi aan pha rol la tsha nyid du 'gyur ro // gatstsha ti / sam gatstsha te /

original: aitstsha ti / yatstsha ti /
analyzed: aitstsha ti / yatstsha ti /

analyzed: sam sngon ma can gyi ga m'i tu tsa sogs so // p'a'i bi ba'o //

original: pa 'thung ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la bi ba ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa 'thung ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la bi ba ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Pā means “to drink.” The ending of this is changed to v in the future.

original: pi ba ti /
analyzed: pi ba ti /
translated: Pibati.

analyzed: pi ba ti'i dbyi ste zhes pa'i shes par byed pa la yon tan med do //
translated: Pibati is the optative. There is no quality in the optative.

original: ghr'a'i dzi ghra'o //🔽ghra tri len pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i @235a * //
analyzed: ghr'a'i dzi ghra'o // ghra tri len pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i @235a * //

original: aan pha rol la dzi ghra ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aan pha rol la dzi ghra ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ending of this is changed to ghr in the future.

original: dzi ghra ti /
analyzed: dzi ghra ti /
translated: Gharati.

original: dhm'a'i dha ma'o //
analyzed: dhm'a'i dha ma'o //
translated: Dham means “to be.”

original: dhma sgra dang me kun du sbyor ba dag la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la dha ma ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽dha ma ti /🔽sth'a'i tishtha'o // shth'a gnas pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pa pha rol la tishtha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽tishth ti / mn'a'i ma na'o//
analyzed: dhma sgra dang me kun du sbyor ba dag la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la dha ma ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // dha ma ti / sth'a'i tishtha'o // shth'a gnas pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pa pha rol la tishtha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // tishth ti / mn'a'i ma na'o//
translated: The affix aṇ is added to the root dham and the word samyoga.🔽The affix ati is added to the root sthā.

original: mn'a goms pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la man ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽ma ni ti /
analyzed: mn'a goms pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la man ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // ma ni ti /
translated: The affix aṇ is added to the root mnā.

original: d'ana'i yatstsha'o // d'an sbyin sbyin pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la yatstsha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽yatstsha ti / d'ana'i na yig 'di'i don to //🔽dri shi'i pa shya'o //
analyzed: d'ana'i yatstsha'o // d'an sbyin sbyin pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la yatstsha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // yatstsha ti / d'ana'i na yig 'di'i don to // dri shi'i pa shya'o //
translated: The affix ati is added to the root dā.

original: dri shir lta ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la pa shya ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro ;🔽/ pa shya ti /
analyzed: dri shir lta ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la pa shya ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro ;🔽/ pa shya ti /
translated: The affix aṇ is added to the root paśy.

original: aarti'i ritstsha'o // ri 'gro ba dang thob pa dag la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la ritstsha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aarti'i ritstsha'o // ri 'gro ba dang thob pa dag la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la ritstsha ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and ric are for going to a mountain and for obtaining.

original: ritstsha ti / sarti'i dh'a ba'o //
analyzed: ritstsha ti / sarti'i dh'a ba'o //
translated: ricati, sarati, dhava

original: dri shir lta ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i pha rol la sa shu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri shir lta ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i pha rol la sa shu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //

original: dh'a ba ti /
analyzed: dh'a ba ti /
translated: dhavati,

original: dh'a ba bsgyur ba ni 'gyogs par 'gro ba la 'dod pa'o //🔽des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dh'a ba bsgyur ba ni 'gyogs par 'gro ba la 'dod pa'o // des na 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: dhav is for going quickly.

original: pri yam aa nu sa ra ti /
analyzed: pri yam aa nu sa ra ti /
translated: Therefore, it does not occur here.🔽priyam anusarati,

original: sri 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: sri 'gro ba la'o //
translated: sarati,

original: dh'a bu 'gro ba dang dag pa la'o zhes pa'i byings gnyis kyi /
analyzed: dh'a bu 'gro ba dang dag pa la'o zhes pa'i byings gnyis kyi /

original: sarti / dh'a ba ti /
analyzed: sarti / dh'a ba ti /
translated: sarati, dhavati

original: zhes pa'i sbyor ba gnyis grub pa la sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba min no zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sbyor ba gnyis grub pa la sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba min no zhes gsung ngo //
translated: The two applications of these two roots are not to be begun.

original: sha di'i sh'i ya'o //
analyzed: sha di'i sh'i ya'o //
translated: śadi, śayi

original: shadli nyams pa la'o //
analyzed: shadli nyams pa la'o //
translated: śad is for falling.🔽śad is for fear, going, and giving.

original: shadli la 'jigs pa dang 'gro ba la 'jug pa dang sbyin pa rnams la'o zhes pas yang na'o //
analyzed: shadli la 'jigs pa dang 'gro ba la 'jug pa dang sbyin pa rnams la'o zhes pas yang na'o //
translated: In the Śadvarga, fear, going, and giving.🔽

original: sha di'i aan pha rol la sh'i ya ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha di'i aan pha rol la sh'i ya ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word śāḍī is changed to śāyi on the other side of the Sindhu.

original: sh'i ya te /
analyzed: sh'i ya te /
translated: The flesh of the deer is yours.🔽🔽

original: shadi'i aanbi ka ra na'i yul la a'atma ne'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: shadi'i aanbi ka ra na'i yul la a'atma ne'i tshig bshad par bya ste /
translated: The word śāḍī is explained in the land of Vikaraṇa as ātmani.

original: ru tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ru tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the very thing, such as ruca.

original: sha di'i sh'ida'o //
analyzed: sha di'i sh'ida'o //
translated: Śāḍī is śāyi.

original: shadli 'jigs pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la sh'id du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shadli 'jigs pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i aan pha rol la sh'id du bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Śāḍī means fear. This is changed to śāyi on the other side of the Sindhu.

original: ru tra sh'id ti /🔽dza ni'i bi ka ra na la dz'a'o //
analyzed: ru tra sh'id ti / dza ni'i bi ka ra na la dz'a'o //
translated: Rukṣa is śāyita.🔽In the land of Jānivikaraṇa, jā is used.

original: dza ni rab tu skye ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i bi ka ra na pha rol la dzu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽dz'a ya te /
analyzed: dza ni rab tu skye ba la'o zhes pa 'di'i bi ka ra na pha rol la dzu ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // dz'a ya te /
translated: Jāni means birth. This is changed to jū on the other side of Vikaraṇa.🔽Jāyate🔽Yajāyate

original: ya dz'a ye te /
analyzed: ya dz'a ye te /
translated: Jāyante

original: dz'a yante / di ba sogs las yana'o //
analyzed: dz'a yante / di ba sogs las yana'o //
translated: The suffix ya is added from di and so on.

original: dza na skye ba la'o zhes pa 'di ma smos pa ni bi ka ra na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dza na skye ba la'o zhes pa 'di ma smos pa ni bi ka ra na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word jāni is not mentioned here because there is no Vikaraṇa.

original: yan la'o zhes bya ba la bi ka ra na smos pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
analyzed: yan la'o zhes bya ba la bi ka ra na smos pa ni phyi ma'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of Vikaraṇa in “ya” is for the sake of the future.

original: dzny'a'i'ang ngo // dzny'a rtogs pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i bi ka ra na pho rol la dza ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dzny'a'i'ang ngo // dzny'a rtogs pa la'o zhes pa 'di'i bi ka ra na pho rol la dza ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Jñā means “to know.” In this [case], the vi-karaṇa ṇā is changed to ṇu on the other side.

original: dz'a n'a ti /
analyzed: dz'a n'a ti /
translated: Jñā-ti.

original: p'u sogs rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
analyzed: p'u sogs rnams kyi thung ngu'o //
translated: The short [vowel] of pu and so on.

original: p'ung dag pa la'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bi ka ra na pha rol la thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: p'ung dag pa la'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i bi ka ra na pha rol la thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: The vi-karaṇa of pu and so on becomes short on the other side.

original: pu n'a ti /
analyzed: pu n'a ti /
translated: Pu-na-ti.

original: lu n'a ti /
analyzed: lu n'a ti /
translated: Lu-na-ti.

original: pastri n'a ti /
analyzed: pastri n'a ti /
translated: Satri-na-ti.

original: p'uny dag pa la'o //
analyzed: p'uny dag pa la'o //
translated: Pu means “to purify.”

original: luny gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: luny gcod pa la'o //
translated: Lu means “to cut.”

original: striny sgrib pa la'o //
analyzed: striny sgrib pa la'o //
translated: Satri means “to obscure.”

analyzed: thung ngu'o // pu sogs @235b rnams brita'i mthar thug pa'i bar rnams so //

original: bi ka ra na la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: bi ka ra na la zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: pu ya te /
analyzed: pu ya te /

analyzed: gsal byed dang po yon tan can gyi byings thams cad la la auta'i 'phel ba'o //

analyzed: au yig gi 'phel bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gsal te dang po yon tan can te /

analyzed: yon tan dang bcas pa'i byings thams cad pa la yon tan can no // yoo ti / yooshi /

original: stoo ti / stooshi /
analyzed: stoo ti / stooshi /

original: yu spel ba la'o //
analyzed: yu spel ba la'o //

original: shtunya bstod pa la'o //
analyzed: shtunya bstod pa la'o //
translated: To praise.

original: aanbi ka ra na'o //
analyzed: aanbi ka ra na'o //

original: aad sogs las 'jig go //
analyzed: aad sogs las 'jig go //

original: 'dis 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'phel ba'o //
translated: To increase.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,🔽to decrease

original: stoo tu / aa stoot /
analyzed: stoo tu / aa stoot /

original: panytsa m'i'i tu dang hya sta n'i'i di'o //
analyzed: panytsa m'i'i tu dang hya sta n'i'i di'o //

original: yu yig ces pa ci zhe na /🔽ae ti / ae tu /
analyzed: yu yig ces pa ci zhe na / ae ti / ae tu /
translated: What is the letter y?

original: ai nu 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: ai nu 'gro ba la'o //
translated: To go and to go there.🔽To follow.

original: aoo zhes bya ba ming sngon ma can gyi 'phel ba mi rtag pa'i don te /
analyzed: aoo zhes bya ba ming sngon ma can gyi 'phel ba mi rtag pa'i don te /
translated: The word o means increase of the former name, with the meaning of impermanence.

original: des na bi ka ra na rnams las de dag gi mi 'gyur te /🔽su no ti /
analyzed: des na bi ka ra na rnams las de dag gi mi 'gyur te / su no ti /
translated: Therefore, they do not change from the vikaraṇas.🔽To praise.

original: yo yo ti /🔽yu bsre ba la la'o //
analyzed: yo yo ti / yu bsre ba la la'o //
translated: To praise.🔽To increase.

original: shin tu sbre ba la ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbre ba la ya sgra'o //
translated: To very much increase.

original: tse kr'i yi ta'i yang na 'jig go //
analyzed: tse kr'i yi ta'i yang na 'jig go //
translated: To destroy.

original: gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: gnyis brjod do //
translated: To two.

original: gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽ya b'a ni /
analyzed: gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na / ya b'a ni /
translated: What is the first consonant?🔽 To go.

original: yu ba sre ba la'o //
analyzed: yu ba sre ba la'o //
translated: To increase.

original: panya tsa m'i'i a'a ni'o //
analyzed: panya tsa m'i'i a'a ni'o //
translated: To five.

original: yut: ; tasa'o //
analyzed: yut: ; tasa'o //
translated: To that.

original: byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the all-purpose root?

original: sto t'a / a'urno ti'i yang yon tan no //
analyzed: sto t'a / a'urno ti'i yang yon tan no //
translated: To praise and to increase.

original: a'urnu'i au yig gi gsal byed dang po la yon tan dang bcas pa pha rol la yang na 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'urnu'i au yig gi gsal byed dang po la yon tan dang bcas pa pha rol la yang na 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The first consonant of the vowel ū of the word urṇu, together with the guna, becomes the pluta in the other [word].

original: thob pa la rnam par brtag pa'o //🔽prornoo ti / prarno ti /
analyzed: thob pa la rnam par brtag pa'o // prornoo ti / prarno ti /
translated: The pluta is analyzed.🔽prorṇoti, prarṇoti,

original: prorno ti / prornoo mi /
analyzed: prorno ti / prornoo mi /
translated: prorṇoti, prorṇomi,

original: prornooshi gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: prornooshi gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: prorṇomi. What is the first consonant?

original: prornu b'a ni /
analyzed: prornu b'a ni /
translated: prorṇavāni.

original: yon tan can la zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽prarnu ta / hyasta n'i la'ang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan can la zhes pa ci zhe na / prarnu ta / hyasta n'i la'ang ngo //
translated: What is the one with the guna?🔽prarṇuta, hyastanīlāṃ ca.

original: a'urnu'i hyasta n'i pha rol la yon tan du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'urnu'i hyasta n'i pha rol la yon tan du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: The guna also becomes the pluta in the other [word] hyastanī of the word urṇu.

original: snga mas phyogs gcig la 'phel ba'i dmigs bsal lo //
analyzed: snga mas phyogs gcig la 'phel ba'i dmigs bsal lo //
translated: The previous [rule] is an exception to the increase of one part.

original: proornot / hyasta n'i'i di'o //
analyzed: proornot / hyasta n'i'i di'o //
translated: prorṇot, hyastanīdi.

original: dbyangs dang po rnams kyi dang po'i 'phel ba'o zhes pas aoo yig tu bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang po rnams kyi dang po'i 'phel ba'o zhes pas aoo yig tu bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The first vowel is increased. Thus, it is changed to the letter o.

original: tri hi'i bi ka ra na la aita'o //
analyzed: tri hi'i bi ka ra na la aita'o //
translated: The i of trihi is vikaraṇa.

original: gsal byed dang po yon tan can zhes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: gsal byed dang po yon tan can zhes pa 'jug ste /
translated: The first consonant is the one with the guna. Thus, it is applied.

original: triha / hi si 'tshe ba las so zhes pa 'di bi ka ra na las pha rol tu ait a'a ga mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: triha / hi si 'tshe ba las so zhes pa 'di bi ka ra na las pha rol tu ait a'a ga mar 'gyur te /
translated: trih,  from hi,  violence. This becomes itaagama in Vikarana.

original: gsal byed dang po yon tan can pha rol pa'o //
analyzed: gsal byed dang po yon tan can pha rol pa'o //
translated: The first consonant is the one that is qualified.

original: aita'o ta yig ni sngon gyi slob dpon pa rab tu grags pa'i a'a ga mar gsal bar byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: aita'o ta yig ni sngon gyi slob dpon pa rab tu grags pa'i a'a ga mar gsal bar byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: The syllable ta is for the purpose of clarifying the well-known agama of the former teacher.

original: tri nedhi ; tri nekshi /
analyzed: tri nedhi ; tri nekshi /
translated: tri neh, tri neksh,

original: trinehmi / barta m'a ni'i ti dang si dang mi'o //
analyzed: trinehmi / barta m'a ni'i ti dang si dang mi'o //
translated: tri nehmi. The ta of tamani is ti, si, and mi.

original: rudha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: rudha sogs kyi dbyangs las zhes pas na sgra'o //
translated: From the vowels of rudha and so on, sound.

original: 'dis ai ta'o //
analyzed: 'dis ai ta'o //
translated: This is ita.

original: ha'i dha'o // gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
analyzed: ha'i dha'o // gha dha dha bha rnams las zhes pas ta'i dha'o //
translated: From gha, dha, dha, bha, sound.

original: sha dang ta sde las zhes pa dha'i dha'o //
analyzed: sha dang ta sde las zhes pa dha'i dha'o //
translated: From sha and the ta group, sound.

original: dha la dha'i dbyi'o //
analyzed: dha la dha'i dbyi'o //
translated: The syllable dha is the vowel of dha.

original: sa yig pha rol la sha dha'i sa la ka'o //
analyzed: sa yig pha rol la sha dha'i sa la ka'o //
translated: The syllable sa is shadhi for the one beyond.

original: aa tri ne ta /
analyzed: aa tri ne ta /
translated: atrine ta.

original: hyasta n'i'i di'o //
analyzed: hyasta n'i'i di'o //
translated: hyastani di.

original: na sgra'o// @236a * //
analyzed: na sgra'o// @236a * //
translated: The syllable na is sound.

original: aita'o // gsal byed las di si dag dbyi'o //
analyzed: aita'o // gsal byed las di si dag dbyi'o //
translated: ita. From the consonant, di and si are the vowels.

original: ha'i dha'o // gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: ha'i dha'o // gsal byed dang po la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: hi, sound. What about the first consonant?

original: trin h'a ni /
analyzed: trin h'a ni /
translated: ṭiṇha.

original: yon tan can zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan can zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is guṇin?

original: tindha:/ tasa'o // na sgra'o //
analyzed: tindha:/ tasa'o // na sgra'o //
translated: ṭiṇḍha. ṭas. The suffix na.

original: ru dha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: ru dha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: The suffix vi-karaṇa of ru-dha, etc. is elided.

original: snga ma bzhin du dha nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dha nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dhas, etc. are as before.

original: na las so zhes bya ba la bi ka ra na smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: na las so zhes bya ba la bi ka ra na smos pa ni rnam pa gsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: From na. The mention of vi-karaṇa is for the sake of clarifying the form.

original: br'u las ngag dang por a'ita'o //🔽gsal byed dang po yon tan can dbyings thams cad pa la zhes pa 'jug go //
analyzed: br'u las ngag dang por a'ita'o // gsal byed dang po yon tan can dbyings thams cad pa la zhes pa 'jug go //
translated: From brū, the first of the other’s speech is āita.🔽The first consonant of the guṇin is placed at the beginning of all the syllables.

original: br'u nya las pha rol gyi ngag gang yin pa de'i gsal byed dang po yon tan can gyi byings thams cad pa'i dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: br'u nya las pha rol gyi ngag gang yin pa de'i gsal byed dang po yon tan can gyi byings thams cad pa'i dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
translated: The first consonant of the guṇin of whatever is the first consonant of the other’s speech is āita.

original: ta yig ni ait las kyang zhes pa'i don to //🔽bra b'i ti /🔽bra b'i sha /
analyzed: ta yig ni ait las kyang zhes pa'i don to // bra b'i ti / bra b'i sha /
translated: The syllable ta is also from ita.🔽brāvi-ti.🔽brāvi-ṣa.

original: bra b'i mi /🔽bra b'i tu /
analyzed: bra b'i mi / bra b'i tu /
translated: brāvi-mi.🔽brāvi-tu.

original: aa bra b'i ta /
analyzed: aa bra b'i ta /
translated: abrāvi-ta.

original: gsal byed dang po zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gsal byed dang po zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the first consonant?

original: bra b'a ni /
analyzed: bra b'a ni /
translated: brāva.

original: yon tan zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is guṇa?

original: pru y'at / byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: pru y'at / byings thams cad pa la zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “in all roots”?

original: bakt'a 'bru'i rtsi'o //
analyzed: bakt'a 'bru'i rtsi'o //
translated: bakta means “juice of a grain.”

original: tse kr'i yi ta /
analyzed: tse kr'i yi ta /
translated: cekriyāt.

original: 'jig pa'i mtha' la yang na 'dod de /🔽bo bha b'i ti /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i mtha' la yang na 'dod de / bo bha b'i ti /
translated: The end of destruction is also desired.🔽bo bhavati.

original: bo bhoo ti /
analyzed: bo bhoo ti /
translated: bo bhoti.

original: ro ra b'i ti /
analyzed: ro ra b'i ti /
translated: ro ra bhavati.

original: ro roo ti /
analyzed: ro roo ti /
translated: ro ro bhoti.

original: shin tu 'byung ngo shin tu brjod do la ya sgra'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'byung ngo shin tu brjod do la ya sgra'o //
translated: The word ya is for “arises” and “is expressed.”

original: 'jig go // tsarka r'i tam /
analyzed: 'jig go // tsarka r'i tam /
translated: Carkarīta.

original: pa rasmee tshig la sogs pa'ang ngo //
analyzed: pa rasmee tshig la sogs pa'ang ngo //
translated: Parasmai is also for “words” and so on.

original: aasti la di si dag la'o //
analyzed: aasti la di si dag la'o //
translated: astidasi.

original: aas yod pa la'o //
analyzed: aas yod pa la'o //
translated: as means “exists.”

original: zhes pa 'di las pha rol gyi di dang si dag las dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di las pha rol gyi di dang si dag las dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
translated: From this, āyāt comes first from the other di and si.🔽āyāt.

original: a'a si ta /
analyzed: a'a si ta /
translated: Asta!🔽🔽

original: a'a s'i / hasta n'i'i di dang si'o //
analyzed: a'a s'i / hasta n'i'i di dang si'o //
translated: hasti nidisi.

original: aast'i zhes pas aa yig gi a'a yig go //
analyzed: aast'i zhes pas aa yig gi a'a yig go //
translated: Because of astit, the ā of a is ā.

original: di dang lhan cig spyod pa smos pas 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: di dang lhan cig spyod pa smos pas 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the mention of “co-occurrence with di,” it does not occur here.🔽asiti.

original: aa si / si la aa ti'i si la'o zhes pas sa dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa si / si la aa ti'i si la'o zhes pas sa dbyi'o //
translated: Because of “si for si,” the sa is elided.

original: di si zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: di si zhes pa ci zhe na /

original: aasti / ti nges par bstan pa la bhu ru bsgyur bar byas pa na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: aasti / ti nges par bstan pa la bhu ru bsgyur bar byas pa na mi 'gyur te /
translated: If ti is to be taught with certainty, it is changed to bhu, but it is not changed in

original: aa bh'ut / aa bhu:/🔽ain sth'a d'a zhes pas si tsa 'jig go //
analyzed: aa bh'ut / aa bhu:/ ain sth'a d'a zhes pas si tsa 'jig go //
translated: avabhūta, avabhūḥ,🔽and in ain sthā.

original: si tsa las so //
analyzed: si tsa las so //
translated: From sita,

original: si tsa las pha rol gyi di si dag las dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
analyzed: si tsa las pha rol gyi di si dag las dang por a'it a'a ga ma 'gyur ro //
translated: from sita, from the other di of s, ād is first.

original: aa k'arsh'a:/ aa l'a bhit /
analyzed: aa k'arsh'a:/ aa l'a bhit /
translated: ākāraḥ, ākṛṣṭaḥ,🔽ālabdhit, ālabdhaḥ,

original: a'a l'a bhi:/ rud sogs rnams las kyang ngo //
analyzed: a'a l'a bhi:/ rud sogs rnams las kyang ngo //
translated: and from rud and so on.

original: mtshon par bya ba'i ngor rud sogs ldan lnga rnams gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtshon par bya ba'i ngor rud sogs ldan lnga rnams gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Also the five, rud and so on, are to be taken for the sake of the object of indication.

original: ru dir mchim 'dzag pa la'o //
analyzed: ru dir mchim 'dzag pa la'o //
translated: Rud is for tears.

original: nyi sva pa nyal ba la'o //
analyzed: nyi sva pa nyal ba la'o //
translated: Niṣva is for sleeping.

original: shvas srog 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: shvas srog 'dzin pa la'o //

original: aana'ang ngo // dza ksha za ba la'o //
analyzed: aana'ang ngo // dza ksha za ba la'o //
translated: aṃ is also so. Jaksma is for eating.
